definition: cup/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Clean the broken cup up please.
He dashed the cup down in his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他生氣了，使勁把杯子擲下。

sentences.english: Status Offline Why See the Glass Half Empty?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼要把杯子看成是半杯空的呢？

sentences.english: She used the cup for a soup bowl.
sentences.chinese: 她把那個杯子用作盛湯的碗。

sentences.english: The cup with a cover is li leis .
sentences.chinese: 那個帶蓋子的杯子是李雷的。

sentences.english: The tea cup was filled to the brim.
Alice poured some juice into a cup.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉絲倒了一些果汁到杯子裏。

sentences.english: The waiter goes to clean up the glass.
sentences.chinese: 於是服務生去清理破掉的杯子。

sentences.english: She put salt in her cup of tea by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 她誤把鹽放進裝着茶的杯子裏。

sentences.english: He dashed a cup down in a temper.
There are tea leaves in my cup - you haven't strained the tea.
sentences.chinese: 我的杯子裏有茶葉，你沒有濾過茶。

sentences.english: Spoon the mousse in the glasses. Frozen until set.
sentences.chinese: 把慕斯分盛在杯子裏，冷藏至凝固。

sentences.english: A clumsy dog knocked the cup over.
sentences.chinese: 一條笨拙的狗將杯子弄翻了。

sentences.english: Gather forth the White Oil, the Black Cup and the Blood of the Ten Sinners.
sentences.chinese: 在我面前放下白油，黑色的杯子和十個罪人的鮮血。

definition: tea prepared in large quantity using inexpensive tea leaves
to drain the cup in one gulp (idiom)
